did.unittitle: American Philosophical Society Archives. Record Group IIb
did.abstract:
This is part of the large inventory for the American Philosophical Society Archives. For complete information concerning this collection, please view the
Collection Description.

did.unittitle: An Account of experiments made on palladium, found in combination with pure gold;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Rio de Janeiro] L.S. 2p. and end. In Spanish. Received his diploma of membership in the American philosophical society from Condy Raguet. Appreciation for honor. Presents his Constituicao moral. Cf. Minutes - May 19, 1826.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

For additional correspondence, see: Letter from Latrobe to C.W. Peale; March 4, 1807: and, Letter from A.P.S. Report...; [read] March 20, 1807. Varlé to Wister; Nov. 20, 1806.

Although he has never received notice of his nomination, he has heard from many persons and seen in Vol.6 of the Transactions of his election to membership in 1804. Expresses appreciation for honor. Presents various works. Mentions Lafayette, Cabanis, and Warden.

Solicits subscription to a proposed publication of Islandic historical monuments by the Islandic society of antiquarians. Encloses an index of the narratives of the voyages in the 11th century to Vinland. Accompanied by English translation in hand of Nicholas Collin (?), 4p. See A.P.S. Minutes,Feb. 4,1825.

did.unittitle: Catalogue of the library of the American philosophical society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: unp. F. (Manuscript) Arranged alphabetically by author, giving author, title, number of volumes and size, case and shelf number and donor. On frontispage is given an explanation of abbreviations used, also explanation of French calendar, 1792-1804. Contains manuscript note - This book was delivered by the stationer on Tuesday 18th of January 1814 - The catalogue was finished on Friday the 25th of February, i.e. a space of 33 days Sundays excepted. f. p, no.1.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: D. 3vols. Kept by Peter S. DuPonceau. Presented by P.S.DuPonceau; 27 June 1834. Vol. II, see p. 39 for directions from W. Ward for sending mail to Dr. Wilkins, W.B.Bailey and Lieut A. Lockett; p. 42 for note that Ebeling's successor is E.F.A. Hartmann; p. 47 for address for Pierre Alexandre Vernet; vol. III, see pp. 7, 45, 57, 61, for address for Baron Coquebert de Montbret; p.9 for note of new correspondents, T. Pavenstedt and Gottlieb Ernst Schulze; p. 12 address for Jean Baptiste Say; p. 14 address to send books to LeHavre, France; p. 23 address for Musset Pathay; p. 56 address for Pichon; p. 57 addresses for Mr. Shaler and Mrs. Rivardi; and p. 61 for address for James G. Carter. Tipped in in front of vol. I there are newspaper clippings of professors at Harvard university; vol. II, officers of the Literary and philosophical society of New York; list of Indian agents and superintendents in the U.S. ; articles on the growth of of newspapers in the U.S.; advertisement by J. Sonter to sell American publications in Great Britain; and a clipping concerning a French and Indian village in Maine. Miscellaneous notes may be found on page [ii] of vol. II, concerning people who possess knowledge of Indian tongues, expecially John Gambold. Volumes 1 and 2 are indexed. See p. [65] of vol. 1, and p. 61 of vol. 2 for indices.
